Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable use of data to drive fast, accurate decision making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

Core to our success is how we deliver for our stakeholders, and how we enable our teams to do so. As such, we are looking for a Delivery Manager who can support, coach, mentor and guide our teams to deliver initiatives, projects, and programs.

The Delivery Manager will be accountable for supporting the data tribe in planning and delivering workstreams across analytics and engineering. You will be part of the Data tribe, working closely with our analysts and engineers, providing delivery management support and leadership.

 * Coaching teams to be predictable, sustainable, value-driven and flexible.
 * Support the team by collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the team has clarity on vision and goals.
 * Maintaining team focus on committed goals, by removing blockers, managing dependencies and risks.
 * Tracking and reporting on team progress towards goals, managing expectations and communicating change.
 * Working across organisational & geographical boundaries, to help teams overcome obstacles and get the best value against constraints.
 * Drive a culture of effective communication with stakeholders.
 * Driving a continuous improvement mindset, and developing self-sufficient teams.
   
   

Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:


 * Passionate about continuous improvement.
 * An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
 * Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
 * An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
 * Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
 * Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
 * Value and outcome-driven, with a positive “can-do” attitude.
 * Motivated by coaching teams & individuals to deliver great outcomes.
   
   

A Successful Candidate Will Have


 * Expert knowledge and experience (5+ Years) cultivating high performing teams utilizing Agile & Lean techniques.
 * Proven track record (5+ Years) of delivering multiple technical or digital projects and/or products meeting outcomes and driving business value.
 * Experience of working across the full Software Development Life Cycle in a dynamic fast paced environment.
 * Demonstrable experience applying Agile principles into real world practices that work for the teams they support.
 * Proven track record of successful collaboration across functions and disciplines
   
   

Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


 * Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
 * A competitive and attractive compensation package
 * Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
 * A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities
   
   

Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

 * Develop a global sales strategy to achieve defined sales targets

 * Take ownership of negotiations from initial contact to contract sign off and handle RFIs and RFPs

Specific Responsibilities


 * Deliver revenue targets from new clients and existing SGS clients that do not have an global/international contract

 * Actively follow up on all proposals and conduct client presentation where required.
 * Develop relationships with and work with all local sales teams and global product owners and refer local clients to local sales teams. Attend local sales meetings.

 * Operates to the highest standards of ethics, in accordance with the SGS Code of Integrity
   
   

Qualifications


 * You are a hunter who has a creditable track record of identifying new sales opportunities and closing them;
 * Experience of selling in a B2B market, to Global/multinational companies;
 * High level of knowledge of Business Assurance business and products and / or detailed knowledge of target sector

title: InPlanet Foundation Manager
description:
About InPlanet

We are an impact-driven, remote-first, ClimateTech (CDR) startup headquartered in Germany and Brazil to reverse climate change and make tropical agriculture more regenerative, low-carbon, and sustainable. We are working with Enhanced Rock Weathering in tropical agriculture, focusing on Brazil. We do this to create a liveable planet for future generations and, specifically, to regenerate soils and ecosystems, grow nutritious food, and increase food security and sovereignty in the tropics.

People-first, Performance Culture: We believe that focus on people and performance can co-exist with the right cultural vision. Our philosophy is to blend these two essential components. The Rocket symbolizes our commitment to peak performance, excellence, and reaching new heights. The Heart represents our dedication to our people, fostering empathy, compassion, and genuine care for every team member's well-being.

We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are proud to have an internationally growing team and we are designing our people practices to serve psychological safety, belonging, and authenticity.

You can check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor to check how people find interviewing with us.

About The Role

At InPlanet, we are dedicated to supporting our communities in Brazil and beyond. That’s why we are excited to launch the InPlanet Foundation—a new initiative aimed at making a meaningful impact in the lives of those that most suffer from the adverse impacts of climate change. We are looking for a Foundation Manager who will lead the charge in creating and shaping this vital effort from the ground up. If you thrive on solving complex challenges and are passionate about making a real difference, we want to hear from you! Initiatives can range from supporting those impacted by natural disaster, social impact by enabling women in sustainable agriculture, DEI or education and innovation around climate change.

The Impact You Can Make

In this role, you will have a direct impact on the lives of individuals and communities affected by climate change. You’ll take this initiative from concept to reality, identifying the most effective ways to respond to crises, support rebuilding efforts, and prepare communities for the future. Your decisions will help us move closer to a more resilient world, as you develop strategic programs, oversee their implementation, and lead the Foundations fundraising efforts.

We are looking for a passionate leader with a strategic mindset, adaptability, and the ability to excel in a dynamic environment where innovative solutions are being developed.

Core Working Relationships

As the Foundation Manager, you will collaborate closely with InPlanet’s Founders and the wider leadership team to ensure that the foundation’s mission aligns with our broader organizational goals. You will also nurture relationships with local governments, NGOs, and community leaders to ensure our programs address the real needs of the affected communities. Additionally, you will partner with finance and operations teams to responsibly manage budgets and ensure transparency in resource allocation. Through these collaborative relationships, you will drive the foundation’s success and make a lasting impact.

Key Responsibilities

Core Skills & Experience


 * Strategic Planning: You’ll craft a flexible strategy that aligns with our evolving mission
 * Program Management: You have experience designing and implementing impactful, social, CSR programs from scratch, ensuring they stay aligned with overarching goals.
 * Fundraising & Development: You know how to lead fundraising campaigns, write compelling grant proposals, and build strong donor relationships to secure the resources we need.
 * Partnership Building: You can foster strong relationships with NGOs, governments, and community groups to ensure we’re working collaboratively toward effective initiatives.
 * Financial Oversight: You’ve managed budgets before and can ensure that every resource is used efficiently, transparently, and with maximum impact.
 * Monitoring & Evaluation: You can set up systems to measure the success of our programs and use data to continually improve outcomes.
 * Incorporation and Administration: You know how to incorporate and administer the Foundation, making sure that all organizational processes are set up and running smoothly.
   
   

Key Qualities (Trust + Drive + Impact)


 * Self-Starter: You have a hands-on attitude and aren’t afraid to take the initiative to get things moving.
 * Mission-Driven: You care deeply about helping communities and making a lasting impact. You see beyond short-term fixes and focus on long-term resilience.
 * Collaborative Leader: You can build and inspire a team, fostering a culture of openness, learning, and shared purpose.
 * Problem Solver: You’re resourceful and creative, always looking for new ways to overcome challenges, especially when the path forward isn’t clear.
   
   

Bonus Points


 * Experience working in CSR, social impact, humanitarian aid, or related fields.
 * Familiarity, expertise with climate change-related issues.
 * Background in grant writing, corporate partnerships, or nonprofit fundraising.
 * Previous experience starting or scaling a nonprofit initiative from the ground up.
 * A strong network in the nonprofit or social impact sectors.
   
   

You can be a Rock-Star if you have


 * You care deeply about people and the planet, and you’re driven by making a positive impact.
 * You’re a strategic thinker but also know how to roll up your sleeves and get things done.
 * You have experience leading teams, building partnerships, and managing programs that create real, tangible results.
 * Fundraising doesn’t intimidate you—you know how to build relationships and inspire people to get involved.
 * You’re an excellent communicator and comfortable being the public face of a mission-driven company.
   
   

Living Our Values

At InPlanet, we have a big vision of solving climate change, and we are looking for individuals who are genuinely passionate about making a positive difference in the world of Carbon Removal Solutions. Trust guides our actions, drive fuels our efforts, and impact is our goal.


 * Trust: You believe in being kind and transparent in the workplace, fostering an environment where trust thrives and collaboration flourishes
 * Drive: You possess an innate drive to take action with a hands-on, can-do attitude, propelled by urgency
 * Impact: You dream big and are committed to making a meaningful difference in the world, aligning with our overarching mission to address climate change
   
   

Benefits


 * Salary expectations and our comp philosophy are openly discussed in the first interview with the goal of managing expectations fairly.
 * Home Office Budget
 * Hybrid/Remote: Join us from Brazil with additional remote flexibility but periodic travel/on-site expectation within Sao Paulo & Brazil.
 * Language Programme Monthly Allowance
 * 34+ days annual leave
 * The opportunity to be autonomous, make a huge difference and belong to a vision.
 * Occasional off-sites in Brazil yay!
 * Laptop to fuel your productivity
   
   

InPlanet Compensation Philosophy

At InPlanet, our philosophy revolves around ensuring fair and unbiased compensation and equitable equity pay, coupled with competitive benefits, across all regions where we operate.

The reason behind our salary range being wide or undefined at the first stages of the interview is because of our international presence and globally distributed workforce, we utilize geo ranges to account for varying pay differentials, forming a crucial part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive across diverse markets as we expand our reach.

These ranges are determined by role, level, and location, recognizing the nuanced demands of each market. The actual base pay for the selected candidate is influenced by factors such as location, skills, experience, training, business requirements, and market dynamics, with the range subject to potential adjustments in alignment with our commitment to fairness and transparency.

Application Process

Roughly 6 hours across 3-6 weeks from CV-screening.


 * Interview with Talent & People Partner or Head of People (values & motivation)
 * Interview with the Hiring Manager (required core skills and competencies)
   
   

(optional third interview)


 * Challenge with 3+ team members (specific task, preparation needed)
 * Verbal reference check & psychometric profiling
 * Offer
   
   

How To Apply


 * We kindly ask you to submit your CV in English, as this is the main language we use here at InPlanet (unless it is justified to be in Portuguese).
   
   

Being an equal opportunities employer is very important to us, and we are committed to ensuring that no applicant receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions which cannot be shown to be justifiable. We design our processes to be fair and equitable, and we believe in continuous learning.
